items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.
items.item_text: Information on Public Comments and Disability Access
items.item_text_raw: 2. Information on Public Comments and Disability Access

2.  Advancement on Salary Schedule (PRC)
     a. Activity Payment
	 
	 
See attachment
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Faculty personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details:
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Article 9.20 submission and recommendation: 
Article 9.20 ASSIGNMENT LENGTH AND MAXIMUM LOADING - Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all Districts assigned service during the college semester for which they are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of a full load.  
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 9.20 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.
	 
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 6157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District  Article 15.2.1 submission and recommendation:
	 
Article 15.2.1 Full-time unit members' overload assignment  for compensation and/or overload banking shall be based on a separate contract which shall normally be limited to 6 (six) units or 40% of a full load. Exceptions to this maximum overload shall be negotiated with the Faculty Association.
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 15.2.1 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Faculty Personnel-Adjunct/Overload actions as submitted.

items.item_details:
The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
	 
.
Professional Expert-Licensed Vocational Nurse Position Establishment  
The establishment of the position: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN) in Student Health Services at San Jose City College effective 10/11/11.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details:
The proposed degree programs have been reviewed by the appropriate instructional administrator and approved by the All-College Curriculum Committee, acting on behalf of the local Academic Senate.  The rigor of the approval process assures that these new degree programs have substance and integrity in relation to its discipline and that it fills a clear student need not being served by existing course offerings.  The title of the new degree programs are:
	 
Administration in Justice, Associate in Arts Degree for Transfer
History, Associate in Arts Degree for Transfer
Math, Associate in Science Degree for Transfer

items.item_details:
The courses outlined in this board item are being proposed for Board of Trustee approval.
	 
The proposed courses have been reviewed by the appropriate instructional administrator and approved by the Instructional Policies and Curriculum Committee (IPCC), acting on behalf of the local Academic Senate. The rigor of the approval process assures that each new course has substance and integrity in relation to its discipline and fills a clear student need not being served by existing courses.
	 
The intercollegiate and physical education courses included in this board item are replacing existing courses. The courses are updated and are presented as new courses due to a planned discipline (name) conversion from Athletics/Physical Education to Kinesiology, Wellness and Athletics. 
	 
GLOBL 006:  America in Global Perspective
GLOBL 007:  Global Citizen/Civics
KINAM 018:  Intercollegiate Cross-Country--Men
KINAM 024:  Intercollegiate Golf
KINAM 048:  Intercollegiate Track and Field--Men 
KINAW 048:  Intercollegiate Track and Field--Women
KINAW 052:  Intercollegiate Volleyball
KINPE 008:  Archery
KINPE 024:  Beginning Golf
KINPE 024A:  Intermediate Golf
KINPE 038:  Soccer-Recreational
KINPE 039:  Hatha Yoga
KINPE 040:  Softball
KINPE 052:  Volleyball
KINPE 056:  Weight Training
POLSC 005:  International Law and Human Rights
PSYCH 022:  Research Methods in Psychology
PSYCH 031: Biological Psychology

items.item_details: The Board of Trustees adopted the District's operating budget at its meeting on September 13, 2011.  As required by Board Policy 6250, subsequent budget transfers and revisions must be approved by the Board of Trustees.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the resolution authorizing the budget transfers and revisions of funds within expenditure accounts, authorizing the appropriation of the receipt of unanticipated revenues in certain programs, and authorizing the reversal of appropriations in certain programs due to the non-receipt of program revenues.

items.item_details:
On October 14, 2008, the Board of Trustees awarded the contract of Bid Proposal #0201-08 - Custodial Supplies (Item F-19) to the following vendors:
	 
Vendor
Products
Corporate Express
Towels and Toilet Tissue
Clean Source
Seat Covers
California Janitorial
(Amended on 11/11/2008 - Item F-17)
Hand Soap
	 
This award has now expired.
	 
On April 20, 2011 and April 27, 2011, Bid Proposal #0518-11 - Custodial Supplies was advertised for Districtwide custodial supplies. The bid included "Green" specifications developed by the Custodial and Purchasing Departments. After analyzing the bids, the lowest priced vendors were asked to submit samples of their products and dispensers for evaluation and rating. Attached is the list of vendors who participated in the bid and the list of criteria for which the evaluation was based. 
	 
	 
The recommendation is for a one (1) year award and may be renewed annually, for a total contract term not to exceed three (3) years. Below are the vendors that are recommended for Board approval:
	 
Vendor
Product
P&R Paper Supply
Towels and Toilet Tissue
Clean Source
Seat Covers
Staples
Hand Soap
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees award the contract of Bid Proposal #0518-11 - Custodial Supplies to P&R Paper Supply for towels and toilet tissue, Clean Source for seat covers, and Staples for hand soap.
items.item_text: Award of Contract for Bid Proposal #0518-11 - Custodial Supplies

items.item_details:
The SJCC Metas Program was established through a Title V:HSI grant awarded on October 1, 2008. The budget period 10/01/2011-09/30/2012 is the fourth year of a five-year grant. The Developing Hispanic-Serving Institutions (HSI) Program (referred to as Title V) assists eligible Hispanic-serving institutions of higher education to expand their capacity to serve Hispanic and low-income students. 
	 
The three components of the Title V: HSI are stated in the grant proposal as follows: component one—improve successful progression of Hispanic students from basic skills/ESL to college level and transfer; component two—strengthen support services for Hispanic student success; component three—increase faculty and staff capacity to support Hispanic student success.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the acceptance of grant funds in the amount of $575,000 from the U.S. Department of Education awarded under the Strengthening Institutions â Hispanic Serving Institutions Program for San Jose City College.

items.item_details:
San Jose City College request the board to approve the attached contract amendments of its projected 2011-2012 budget for General Child Care California State Preschool Programs totaling in the amount of $328,939.
	 
These funds will be immediately utilized to subcontract with St. Elizabeth Day Care Home to provide child care assistance to registered San Jose City College student's and families that previously utilized the Child Development Center services .
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustess approve the amendments to the budget contract agreements between SJECCD and California Department of Eduation for fiscal year 2011 and 2012.

items.item_details: Oral reports will be given by members of the Board of Trustees.
Oral reports will be given by Chancellor Rita Cepeda.
Oral reports will be given by the college presidents.
Oral reports will be given by the constituency representatives.

On September 15, 2011, pursuant to Congress by Public Law 100-402, President Barack Obama issued a Presidential Proclamation proclaiming September 15 through October 15, 2011, as National Hispanic Heritage Month.
	 
It is hereby recommended that the Board of Trustees of the San Jose-Evergreen Community College District approve a resolution in support of National Hispanic Heritage Month 2011, and the many students, faculty, staff and administrators of Latino and Hispanic heritage that have made numerous contribution of great value to our colleges. The district also expresses appreciation to the many faculty and staff members, who have created educational events in September and October that paid tribute to National Hispanic Heritage Month 2011.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a resolution in support of National Hispanic Heritage Month, 2011.

items.item_details:
At the September 27, 2011 Board meeting, Chancellor Cepeda and presidents Barbara Kavalier and Henry Yong presented the follow up reports for both colleges for the Board's information and review.  
	 
At this meeting, Evergreen Valley College's follow-up report is coming to the Board for final approval prior to sending to the Accrediting Commission by the October 15, 2011 deadline.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the submission of Evergreen Valley College's Follow Up Report to the Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges.
items.item_text: Accreditation Follow Up Report - Evergreen Valley College
items.item_text_raw: 3. Accreditation Follow Up Report - Evergreen Valley College

items.item_details: The Follow-Up Report provides San José City College’s (SJCC) response to the six college-specific and six shared recommendations noted in the January 31, 2011 letter from the Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges (ACCJC). This report provides evidence of the work that has been completed by faculty, staff, students, and administrators in addressing the deficiencies noted by the ACCJC. The submission deadline for this report is October 15, 2011.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board approve approve the submission of San Jose City College's Follow Up Report to the Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges.
items.item_text: Accreditation Follow-Up Report - San Jose City College
items.item_text_raw: 4. Accreditation Follow-Up Report - San Jose City College

items.item_details: Chancellor Cepeda and Vice Chancellor Hawk will provide a budget update.
Chancellor Cepeda will provide a legislative update.

The level of effort dedicated to the process of board self evaluation is designed to provide concrete evidence of the SJECCD Board of Trustees keen interest in responding to accreditation findings and their desire to create an unprecedented process of transparency and responsiveness to their constituents. 
	 
The Board of Trustees will review and provide input on a draft workplan, which includes an established timeline with measurable outcomes designed to guide the implementation of specific actions that address needed policies, procedures and board development activities.
